title: 1986년 Reginaldo Diaz-Escobar v. Immigration and Naturalization Service 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Reginaldo Diaz-Escobar v. Immigration and Naturalization Service. 판결일: 1986-02-14. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Reginaldo DIAZ-ESCOBAR, Petitioner, v. IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE, Respondent
**판결일**: 1986-02-14
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Choy, Goodwin, Wallace

## 변호인

Michelle L. Crawford, El Centro, Cal., for petitioner., Alison R. Drucker, Washington, D.C., for respondent.

## 인용

- 782 F.2d 1488

## 판결문 요약

782 F.2d 1488
    Reginaldo DIAZ-ESCOBAR, Petitioner,v.IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE, Respondent.
    No. 84-7252.
    United States Court of Appeals,Ninth Circuit.
    Argued and Submitted June 10, 1985.Decided Feb. 14, 1986.
    
      Michelle L. Crawford, El Centro, Cal., for petitioner.
      Alison R. Drucker, Washington, D.C., for respondent.
      Petition for Review of a Decision of the Immigration and Naturalization Service.
      Before CHOY, GOODWIN, and WALLACE, Circuit Judges.
      WALLACE, Circuit Judge:
    
    
      1
      Diaz-Escobar appeals the decision of the Board of Immigration Appeals (BIA) denying his request for asylum and for withholding of deportation.  We have jurisdiction pursuant to 8 U.S.C. Sec. 1105a.  We affirm.
    
    
      2
      * Diaz-Escobar is a native and citizen of Guatemala who entered this country without inspection on October 14, 1982.  On October 18, 1982, the Immigration and Naturalization Service (INS) instituted deportation proceedings against him by issuing an Order to Show Cause.  At his deportation hearing, Diaz-Escobar conceded deportability under 8 U.S.C. Sec. 1251(a)(2), designating Costa Rica as the country of deportation, but petitioned for either asylum or withholding of deportation.
    
    
      3
      He stated in his application for these special relief provisions that he was unwilling to return to Guatemala for fear of being executed or persecuted if he continued to remain neutral in the confli...
